page.title: 13FARMING - WATTLEFIELD HALL
page.content: Wattlefield Hall stands on a farm of 1000 acres, 2/3 grow winter cereals, such as barley and wheat, and 1/3 produces sugar beet which is transported to Bury St Edmunds to be processed. The surrounding fields were used to grow wattle for building many years ago. The building is partly 17th century and partly Victorian, built in Elizabethan style. The old stable is now used for cars, but a new stable provides accommodation for 13 race horses. Ther are also 16 bullocks which will be kept for one year. We saw 4 foals with their mothers in the paddocks. The farm is classified as a mixed farm, mainly arable with pasture for the animals. There are 6 workers on the farm. A large pond outide the house is the start of the river Bays and contains many roach.
